beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: Here's where Paris to Ancaster breaks you. 62 mi. Zone by zone.
beats.text_on_screen: Paris to Ancaster — Where It Hurts
beats.visual: Full route map, then zoom into first zone
beats.editing_note: Start with full route visible, then rapid zoom in. Ominous music hit. Avatar suffering face.

beats.label: ZONE 1: Mile 10
beats.narration: Mile 10. First Mud Sector. If you're not top 300, expect a traffic jam. Walking in deep clay while bikes pile up.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Multi-surface chaos—rail trails to mud chutes in one race

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 1 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 2: Mile 30
beats.narration: Mile 30. Powerline Mud. 'Bike-eating' sector. Derailleurs snap. Chains clog. The carnage peaks here.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Multi-surface chaos—rail trails to mud chutes in one race

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 2 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 3: Mile 50
beats.narration: Mile 50. Late Farm Lanes. Fatigued legs + more mud. By now the course is churned up by 2,000 riders ahead of.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Multi-surface chaos—rail trails to mud chutes in one race

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 3 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 4: Mile 60
beats.narration: Mile 60. Martin Road Climb. Final 1.3km at up to 18% gradient. Cramp central. The sting in the tail after 60 miles.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Multi-surface chaos—rail trails to mud chutes in one race

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 4 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).
